section.name: s44
section.heading: Recognized certification authority to issue a certification practice statement
section.content: A recognized certification authority must issue and maintain an up to date certification practice statement and notify the Commissioner for Digital Policy of changes to the practices of the certification authority as set out in that statement.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Recognized certification authority to maintain repository

subsection.content: A recognized certification authority must maintain or cause to be maintained an on-line and publicly accessible repository.
The Commissioner for Digital Policy must publish in the Gazette a list of the repositories maintained under subsection (1). (Amended L.N. 131 of 2004; L.N. 101 of 2024)
Any list of repositories published under subsection (2) is not subsidiary legislation. (Added 14 of 2004 s. 23)

part.name: P11
part.heading: Provisions as to Secrecy, Disclosure and Offences

section.name: s46
section.heading: Obligation of secrecy

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a person who has access to any record, book, register, correspondence, information, document or other material in the course of performing a function under or for the purposes of this Ordinance shall not disclose or permit or suffer to be disclosed any information relating to another person as contained in such record, book, register, correspondence, information, document or other material to any other person. (Amended 14 of 2004 s. 24)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to disclosure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is necessary for performing or assisting in the performance of a function under or for the purposes of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purpose of any criminal proceedings in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for the purpose of complying with a requirement made under a rule of law with a view to instituting a criminal proceeding in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: under the direction or order of a magistrate or court.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6 and in the case of an individual also to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s47
section.heading: False information
section.content: A person who knowingly or recklessly makes, orally or in writing, signs or furnishes any declaration, return, certificate or other document or information required under this Ordinance which is untrue, inaccurate or misleading commits an offence and is liable in the case of an individual to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months and in any other case, to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Other offences
section.content: A person who makes a false claim that a person is a recognized certification authority commits an offence and is liable in the case of an individual to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months and in any other case, to a fine at level 6.

part.name: P12
part.heading: Secretary’s Power to Amend Schedules and Make Subsidiary Legislation and Immunity of Public Officers

section.name: s49
section.heading: Regulations
section.leadIn: The Secretary may make regulations for all or any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to prescribe the manner of applying to the Commissioner for Digital Policy for recognition or renewal of recognition as a recognized certification authority or for recognition or renewal of recognition of certificates and the manner of recognition; (Amended L.N. 131 of 2004; L.N. 101 of 2024)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to prescribe the fees payable in respect of applications for the recognition of certification authorities, the recognition of certificates or the renewal of such recognition;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to prescribe the form of certification practice statements;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to provide for the manner of appealing against a decision of the Commissioner for Digital Policy and the procedure for determining appeals; (Amended L.N. 131 of 2004; L.N. 101 of 2024)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to provide for such other matters as are necessary or expedient to give effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Secretary may amend Schedules
section.content: The Secretary may by order published in the Gazette amend Schedules 1, 2 and 3.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Protection of public officers

subsection.content: No liability is incurred by the Government or a public officer by reason only of the fact that a recognition is granted, renewed, revoked, suspended or reinstated under Part VII.

Without prejudice to subsection (1), no civil liability is incurred by a public officer in respect of anything done or omitted to be done by the public officer in good faith in the performance or purported performance of any function under a Part other than Part VII.

The protection conferred under subsection (2) does not in any way affect the liability, if any, of the Government for the act or omission of the public officer in the performance or purported performance of the relevant function.
